message: Hi Geeks, which database is perfect for a Java desktop application. My first choice is MySql, but I knew there are some new other databases... I can't remember the names .. with better performance

data.message:
http://www.sqlite.org/
1- Embedded (no need to install a separate server)
2- Faster than MySql
3- The DB is 1 file

yup, an embedded database is your best shot.. there's one implemented in Java, which would be perfect if you want something cross-platform.. there is H2 http://www.h2database.com/html/main.html.. also there is another famous choice, Apache Derby, but it is not as favorable as H2..
the real question is, why are you creating a Java desktop application ? :)
If the database is only gonna be used by this application and not shared by any other apps or services, so you are basically looking for a fancy file format in which case Sqlite is perfect
Hisham Abd El-Hafez Eid because the company resources are perfect in Java :D ..
Hisham Abd El-Hafez Eid do you have other recommendation
tell us more about the requirements ..
Windows Desktop Application - That's enough for public :D
If it's for Windows only, you can use .net
Postgres is the best in my pov
If it's Windows 7 then it has .Net 3.0 built in (it's part of the default installation as far as I remember), so you can go with that :)

This depends on what you want from database engine. If what you need is a simple database with basic functionality I recommend you use "SQLite" It is perfect for small applications, no server needed, high preformance. MySQL is great but it needs a server and might not be suitable for small applications.
